alert.note: Alert for Oconee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 12:23PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, Oconee. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1219 PM EDT, Recent heavy rainfall over much of western and central Oconee County continues to drain along channels toward Lake Hartwell. This will likely produce minor flooding along and Coneross Creek and other tributaries and streams between and Oakway and Seneca which drain toward Lake Hartwell. Any rainfall through mid-afternoon should be fairly light in this area, with water level rises mainly due to drainage from upstream areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Seneca, Lake Hartwell, Oakway and Townville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
